data.description:
Teddy bear tells the time.

Teddy's face shows the hour in numerals, and a hand points to the minutes. Backgrounds colour pairs changes on the hour.

E.g. the screenshot would be 5:04 (i.e. 5 o'clock as indicated by the number in Teddy & the colour pie, ~4 minutes as pointed by the 'minute' hand.


Credits:
Thanks to animation code from OldFogies.

latest_release.release_notes: Bug fix for painting problem for 10pm+.

data.title: Teddy Bear

data.description:
A watchface for people who can't live without their Google Calendars.

Displays two or three nearest events from your calendar.

The watchface stores the nearest 10 events to its memory so it works even if you're in a place without any internet access.

NO companion app required!

Don't forget to set up access to Google Calendar on the watchface settings page.

latest_release.release_notes: Optimized for the new Stand By Mode

Introducing Day-O-Meter! v0.1
A Single hand 24 hour watch. 

Wanna know how much of you day has been wasted? Or... is left to waste? A quick glance at your wrist can tell you that! Wanna know precisely what time it is? Too bad! Click up or down to view another watch face. 

(Now also avaliable in 12 Hour Day-O-Matic form!)

Many many many improvements coming soon! 
Send suggestions to me, and maybe you'll see it in a future iteration or fork. Thanks for looking!

data.author: Grandpa Benjamin

changelog.release_notes: Added extra space before minutes.

data.description:
Just a watch face designed to consume minimal power to have in your locker for emergencies. Such as if you go on a long weekend and forget your charger.

The watch face only updates once an HOUR, therefore only shows the hour. However, if your flick your wrist (like when you activate the back light), the full time including minutes is shown for 30 seconds.

The battery indicator is only updated when the screen is updated (once an hour).

Battery is preserved by only using a small part of the screen and updating infrequently.
data.title: Low Power

data.description:
Fireworks Watchface featuring fireworks created using particle effects with random colors and trajectory and offscreen renderer allowing for composited trails and particle decay.

Utilizes "Glancing" feature to trigger animation and backlight based on watches position to the user (similar to android's ambient mode).

Fireworks particle effects based on :
http://r3dux.org/2010/10/how-to-create-a-simple-fireworks-effect-in-opengl-and-sdl/

latest_release.release_notes: Included both basalt (fw 2.4) as well as chalk (fw 3.6-dp2) as hybrid pbw.

data.author: Neon

changelog.release_notes:
v1.5 - Optional weather.
> Separate sets of icons for light & dark background.

Added optional vibes for:

data.description:
Simple analogue watch with coloured sectors and hour hint. (Colour, Analogue, for Pebble Time). Now with optional vibrations and weather.
Sample times in screenshots are: 10:30PM, 8:34AM, 10:25AM.

1. Hour shown to easily tell time.
  * White: PM,
  * Black: AM.
2. Day of week & date (DDMM) in 2 rows.
3. Middle spoke indicator for bluetooth connectivity & battery level.
  1. bluetooth indicated by colour of centre:
    * White: connected,
    * Pink: disconnected.
  2. battery level:
    * Red: charging
    * Black: draining.
    * spoke rim thickness of 1 to 5 for 5 battery levels of <20% to 100%.
4. Optional weather info using Yahoo Weather data: weather condition and temperature.
 * Configurable options to (a) Use predefined location (tested OK) or Use GPS (not tested yet), and change (b) update interval and (c) temperature units.
 * Yahoo has 49 different weather conditions (incl. NA).
 * Owing to Yahoo Weather service changes, one can no longer get weather for a country as a whole. Instead, one must specify a city/place as well. E.g. use "sisimiut,greenland" instead of "Greenland" alone, "new york,usa" instead of "usa".
Optional vibrations for:
    * Bluetooth connection lost: fading vibe.
    * Hourly chirp. Default: Off, 10am to 8pm.


Inspired by Chromatick.

Credits
Thanks to (1) sample weather codes & icons from tallerthenyou's Simple Weather watchface and alexsum's Timely watchface, (2) weather data from Yahoo.

latest_release.release_notes:
v1.5 - Optional weather.
> Separate sets of icons for light & dark background.

data.title: No Hands (has weather)

data.author: Neon

changelog.release_notes: Add optional weather info at bottom right corner.

Add Betazed (Star Trek).
Add optional hourly vibrations (confugurable timing), vibration on Bluetooth disconnect.

Added more alien font options:
- Aurebesh in handwritten style
- Graalen, Andorian (Star Trek)
- Kentaurus, Greek (Star Trek)
- Mandalorian (Star Wars)
Rosetta: choice of "languages": Human, Klingon (Star Trek, default), and Aurebesh (Star Wars).
Now configurable.
Proper decoded text alignment for date & time.

data.description:
Enigma+ digital, colour watch face variant with choices of alien text for Sci-Fi fans. Optional hourly vibrations (configurable timings), and vibration (fading pulse) on Bluetooth disconnection added.  Previously named 'Enigma Klingon', but the 'language' pool has since expanded:
- Human
- Klingon (from Star Trek universe) (default) (1st screenshot)
- Aurebesh (from Star Wars universe)  (2nd screenshot)
- Aurebesh in handwritten style
- Graalen, Andorian (Star Trek)
- Kentaurus, Greek (Star Trek)
- Mandalorian (Star Wars) 

Choice of information to display in Human language (all other information remains in alien):
1. None (all info stays in alien text)
2. All
3. Time only (default)
4. Date & Time only

Shake to decode all information temporarily for 5 secs.

Info available:
- date (includes weekday name, date in ddmm format in separate rows)
- AM/PM indicated by time bar colour:
  > Red: AM,
  > Blue: PM.
- bluetooth connection & battery level indicators.
  > Battery-level indicator: orange bar (3rd column):
    * Top down: charging,
    * Bottom-up: draining.
  > Bluetooth: weekday name background:
    * Coloured: connected,
    * Black: disconnected.
- weather.
Note: owing to Yahoo Weather service changes, one can no longer get weather for a country as a whole. Instead, one must specify a city/place as well. E.g. use "sisimiut,greenland" instead of "Greenland" alone, "new york,usa" instead of "usa".


Mod of Enigma+.

Credits:
Kudos to kaiserzharkhan, Pixel Saga, Boba Fonts & Erikstormtrooper for creating & sharing all the beautiful fonts.

latest_release.release_notes: Add optional weather info at bottom right corner.

data.title: Enigma+ Rosetta

data.author: Alexander E Smith

changelog.release_notes: - Kicked it so hard, it now sees the curvature of the earth

- Optimized code

- Added sky changes for time of day, and contrasting text color for each state
- Moon position calculation corrected
Initial release

data.description:
= What is SkyLight? =

I'm a sysadmin who works second shift. SkyLight was inspired by my working indoors with no windows and wanting to "see what the sky is doing". I also wanted a watchface that displayed varied at-a-glace data without additional apps, but only when I activated it (to save power).
 
= Instructions =

- Shake your wrist to turn on the backlight as normal.
    * The compass and seconds indicator will activate while the backlight is active 
- If you shake again while the light is still on, it will stay on until you shake again.
    * The compass indicates backlight lock by turning from blue to red.
 
= Features =

Tetherless:
- iso8601 time
- Sun/Moon positions (counter-clockwise, i.e. east->west) 
- Compass and seconds disabled until activated to save battery
- Pebble battery % 
- Day of the week
- Sky changes color based on time of day

Tethered: 
- None yet

= Planned features =

Tetherless: 
- Sun/moon indicators while below the horizon. Was thinking sunflower/mouse (mouse->cheese->moon), let me know what you think
- Moon will show moon phase

Tethered: 
- Weather effects in the sky 
- Current temp 
- Altitude 
- Barometric pressure over time 
- Current speed (when activated) 
- Phone battery %

= Current known issues = 

- sun/moon calc for Arizona, local position soon

= Please send feedback! = 

- Font's not finalized, let me know what would work better
- I'm not married to these colors. Let me know if you like, or want to change, the readability
- Send me wanted features :)

latest_release.release_notes: - Kicked it so hard, it now sees the curvature of the earth

data.title: SkyLight

data.description:
Perceive time differently.

Synesthetes such as Billy Joel and Nikola Tesla have unique sensory experiences where a stimulation of one sense triggers an experience in another cognitive pathway.

This watchface brings you the sensation of associating colours with numbers. But don't let me tell you what colour is 3 or what number is yellow, Choose Yourself!

Synesthesia comes with settings so you can configure your own colours.

This watchface will also vibrate when you disconnect from your phone.
data.title: Synesthesia

data.description: BatSignals is a 3 face collection allowing you to choose which bat signal to shine in the darkness. Each bat signal has a font close to the font used in conjunction with it. Using the signal as an overlay the numbers are partially obscured to give it a projected type look to the signal. The default is Batman Forever, however if you go into the settings you can choose between Batman Forever, Dark Knight, and Arkham. Which batsignal will you choose? Time is kept in 12hr. More options later is possible. More signals? 24hr time...bluetooth, battery indications?

data.author: Gerald

changelog.release_notes: Solved a memoryleak in the watchface.

In this release the problems with the size of the fonts have been solved.
I have added some new functions that some of you requested. 
Have fun!

Because the way the settings are stored have changed, all the current setting are reset to the default settings. 
The config screen is now written with pebble/slate. The settings are now store in the pebble app and the pebble itself. 
The config screen always uses the settings form which are stored on your phone.
In version 2.5 the config screen has changed. Now you can use a color picker.
New function added. Now you can combine the day of the week and the date in one box.
Code cleanup and minor bugfixes
At first start the screen was black. After using the config screen the watchface was shown.
Forgot to activate the empty function. Now you can choose to empty a tile.

In this version there is a config screen which supports:
1. Multi language support. Dutch, English, Italian, German, French and Spanish.
2. 12 and 24 hour support
3. am or pm indicator is displayed in de Day of the Week box
4. Color support based on hex values. Color picker will follow in the future.
5. You can now select which function must be shown in which box.
6. The seconds can also be shown.
7. Every type of box has a small and big font.

Because there is no graphical color picker at this moment, you can select your colors using the following url: http://developer.getpebble.com/tools/color-picker/
Op woensdag werd de tekst niet afgedrukt omdat "Wo" niet in het vak paste. Het font is voor de dag van de week kleiner gemaakt.

Dit is de eerste versie van een ontwerp van een watchface waarbij de tijd, datum en dag van de week worden afgedrukt in vier kwadranten. De watchface is ontworpen door Pieter Dhaeze en door mij gebouwd.

data.description:
This watchface is based on a design from Pieter Dhaeze. 
In this version there is a config screen which supports:
1. Multi language support. Dutch, English, Italian, German, French and Spanish.
2. 12 and 24 hour support. 24 hour notations can only be selected in the setrtings screen of the watch.
3. am or pm indicator can be selected on the config screen and it will be displyed when 12 hour notation is active in the Day of the Week box.
4. Color support. Now you can select colors with a  color picker.
5. Flexibel function per Box. You can select which function must be shown in which box. 
6. Every box has a small and big font.
7. You can show the time, date, day of the week and battery and bluetooth indicators in different combinations.

latest_release.release_notes: Solved a memoryleak in the watchface.

data.description: Here's a minimal one from me.  It's designed to be very battery friendly (once per minute update) and to combine digital and analogue style reading in one face - the digits in the middle are the hour, and you work out the approximate minutes by looking at the angle of the coloured "drop shadow". So in the example picture it's about 6:35.

data.description: Aurebesh is an alphabet from Star Wars and was used for a watchface on 1.x SDK. (https://github.com/chadrien/pebble-watchface-text-watch-aurebesh) Now it has been reborn into SDK 2.x for OG Pebble and a colored version for SDK 3.x on Pebble Time. Now included is a Bluetooth indicator in the lower left corner (letters "BT" in Aurebesh) that changes to "NO" on OG Pebble when disconnected but just changes to red on Pebble Time when disconnected. In lower left corner is Pebble battery indicator in numbers (shows as "+"% when charging). Enjoy!

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: normal numbers... but split
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

I was sketching for a simple way to deform the classic seven-segment-LED-digits and came up with the idea to just let the horizontal segments take a step aside. The result is a confusing bunch of lines. To celebrate this confusion, I emphasized the horizontal and vertial lines with according geometry, pretending, the segments are meant to be there. 

This is a watchface for people who like edges and segments, angles and gaps and a confusing but cool looking display that isn't too hard to be learned. 

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2012, 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: IIE

NOTE: Please see jps Simple Analog for versions that run on Pebble Classic.  This version works on Pebble Time only - based on jps Simple Analog, but themed for Luis GMP

* orange hour markers, hour hand and date
* grey minute hand
* buzz (more strongly than standard jps Simple Analog) and remove hour markers when bluetooth disconnected
* hour markers turn sky blue when battery is below 20%
* second hand *doesn't* stop ticking after a few seconds - in the original jps Simple Analog you have to shake / tap to see the second hand.
data.title: jps Analog LUIS

data.author: Oliver Merkel

changelog.release_notes: It felt like switching to next image has been too late by several hours (at least when observing the Moon from Central Europe). Minor adjustment on this has been done.

Acceleration Event will now display current time in HH:MM, too. This is done as an additional text layer on top of moon phase display for a short time. Hour tick marks are shown for each hour (previously each second hour plus skipping some more tick marks).

Mind that Calendar Week in 2016 is still shown in DIN not ISO format yet. Probably a good reason to add a watch face configuration in an upcoming version.

data.description:
* Moon for Northern Hemisphere is a watchface derived from Decelerate Northern Hemisphere watchface

* Main display is showing the current Moon Phase nearly in full screen

* Decelerate your day with a less stressful time display

* Exact time is shown by analog hour hand represented by a small triangle only or as numerical digital display on acceleration event

* On Accelerometer Event more time information like Calendar Week, Weekday, Day, Month, Year is shown

The watchface shows a single hour hand only. The hour hand is represented by a triangle. Midnight is on bottom of the watchface while Noon is indicated on top. One rotation of the hour hand takes a whole day.

On Accelerometer Event of the watch more detailed time information is displayed for a specific while. On timeout the display toggles back to normal view.

If holding the Pebble watch parallel over ground and turning it so the hour hand is pointing towards the sun then top of the watch face will always point in south direction and bottom of watch face in north direction on northern hemisphere (Compass feature).

Mind the difference of southern hemisphere and northern hemisphere: On southern hemisphere top of the watch face will indicate north direction while bottom of watch face is oriented south.

The current Moon phase is shown for northern hemisphere. Moon phase display is expected to work until end of Unix Time (overflow on Jan 19th, 2038 03:14:07 GMT) at least as implemented here. For simplicity the axis of the Moon is shown vertically on the watch face only.
data.title: Moon for Northern Hemisphere

data.description:
Want to practice your kanji? This is the watch-face for you.
Features 11 characters.

Why it's interesting:
The Japanese number system is similar to the Latin in that it is in base 10, the symbols themselves are different and 10 is represented by 1 character.

For example:
10 = 十
40 = 四十
15 = 十五
45 = 四五

This watch-face is based off big time so it is read left -> right, top -> bottom.

To invert:
Click settings on the phone beneath the picture of the face in your locker, then the three lines, go to 'FOR CLASSIC PEBBLE'.
Then check invert then submit.

To change the orientation so that 12:34 is displayed as:
三一
四二
not
一二
三四
go to 'ORIENTATION' and select your option.
data.title: Traditional Japanese

data.author: Nev Rawlins

changelog.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.description:
Henso

Count the bars and blocks to read the time.

Six bars are for the hours - the blue five are 2 hours each and the outer green bar a single hour.
Five yellow bars are for 10 minute groups and the outer orange bar for a 5 minute group.
Four red blocks, bottom left and top right, are for single minutes 1-4. 

Note. The 12th hour (from midnight or midday) will have no hours displayed.


Screenshots:  
  7:36,  11:59,  4:48,  5:03,  11:59 (Quick View)


Design from the Tokyoflash Design Studio, created by László Scheffer.   The watchface has been produced with the designers' permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash. 

The original design can be found here:  
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2011/01/06/henso-a-designers-watch-concept/

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.description:
Progress Time is an analog-style classic watchface with a twist. It has a clear, free of distractions display.

A flick of your wrist will display current weather conditions and all the details (date, time, BT state, battery level) for a short while.

Do not forget to <3 if you like it!
Visit the Progress Time webpage at http://kozelj.org/progress-time/


In case of low battery level or bluetooth disconnection, it vibrates and displays a warning icon permanently. With low battery level, seconds hand is automatically disabled.

Follow the development here: http://forums.getpebble.com/discussion/26206/watchface-progress-time-for-pebble-time

Weather data is fetched regularly, with shorter retry period if anything goes wrong. During the night the period is longer to conserve battery life.

Customization options:
- disable wrist flick
- continuously display battery level and bluetooth connection status
- continuously display current time and date
- use bold fonts
- display day of week
- date format
- hour hand color
- seconds hand
- details display/lightup timeout
- enable weather information display
- disable GPS usage, enter fixed city name
- configure weather update period
- temperature units

latest_release.release_notes: - fix displaying BT and battery icons

data.title: Progress Time

data.description:
Written Time gives you the time in words so whenever someone asks you for the time you don't even have to formulate a sentence, you can just read your watch.

Includes:
Minutes to the hour
Minutes past the hour
O'Clock on the hour
Says minute not minutes if it is 1 minute to or past the hour!

Doesn't include:
The word minutes if they are divisible by 5. (You'd say 25 to 4 not 25 minutes to 4)
data.title: Written Time

data.description:
This face is inspired by the Apollo Guidance Computer (AGC) and features its green LED display.

The AGC was used in the Apollo Command Module during the moon missions of the 1960's and 70's and provided computational and electronic interfaces for guidance, navigation and control of the spacecraft (source: wikipedia).

data.description:
The future is under your protection with this new BATMAN BEYOND pebble watchface!
every 18 seconds it animates, 
and has a special surprise at the change of the hour!
and in the future (heheh, get it? future) 
you will be able to change the animation timing and speed, and turn off the vibrate on the hour
(if you REALLY hate the vibrate on the hour email me, and I'll send you a modified version with that disabled)


sources:
batman beyond logo ©by DC comics, this watchface uses a modified version of the one by: http://machsabre.deviantart.com/ (he said it's ok to use)

hour change image created by: 
http://dragonfang42.deviantart.com/ based on image from  DC comics
(heavy modified by with compression and conversion) 

Date font:
'Batman Forever font' creator unknown.

Time font:
Cayetano round bold
by: apostrophe

battery meter font:
NinePin Font

data.description: Displays the battery level of your Pebble, and (optionally, with the companion app) your connected phone! Also displays if they are charging, and even if your phone has lost connection with your Pebble.
data.title: Battery Levels

changelog.release_notes: Vibration working on Pebble 2
Fixed vibration not working after watchface restart.

data.description:
Simple retro style flip clock watchface. 

Shows battery status.
Shows charging status.
Shows Bluetooth status.
Vibrates (or not) for Bluetooth connect/disconnect.

To Do:
Animations and weather.
